programme.title: Freaks
programme.desc: Sideshow performers punish acrobat Cleopatra (Olga Baclanova) for humiliating their friend, tiny Hans.

programme.title: Alice, Sweet Alice
programme.desc: Suspicion falls on 12-year-old Alice (Paula E. Sheppard) for killing her sister (Brooke Shields) and others with a butcher knife.

programme.title: The Mysterious Mr. M
programme.desc: A federal agent must stop an evil scientist from deploying a drug that will enable him to steal submarine parts.

programme.title: Dr. Terror's House of Horrors
programme.desc: A traveler's (Peter Cushing) tarot cards tell how an architect, musician, doctor (Donald Sutherland), gardener and critic (Christopher Lee) will die.

programme.title: Carnival of Souls
programme.desc: After taking a job as a church organist, the sole survivor of a fatal car crash encounters phantoms that lure her to a deserted carnival outside of town.

programme.title: The Curse of Frankenstein
programme.desc: The condemned baron (Peter Cushing) recalls making a mute monster (Christopher Lee) in his own image.

programme.title: H.G. Wells' Invisible Man
programme.desc: After agreeing to help a foreign refugees organization, Peter Brady is caught in an elaborate scheme to capture the Invisible Man.

programme.title: Queen of Blood
programme.desc: Astronauts (John Saxon, Basil Rathbone, Judi Meredith) go to Mars and return with a green vampire woman.

programme.title: The Slime People
programme.desc: Waked by nuclear tests, earth-core humanoids dome Los Angeles to make it slimier.

programme.title: The Day It Came to Earth
programme.desc: An alien becomes a flesh-eating zombie when it assumes the form of a murder victim's corpse.

programme.title: Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
programme.desc: Arthur Dent is informed by his friend Ford Prefect that the world is going to end in exactly 12 minutes.

programme.title: Dillinger
programme.desc: John Dillinger's (Lawrence Tierney) crime spree ends in 1934 when the lady in red (Anne Jeffreys) shows the FBI where he is.

programme.title: The Lawless Years
programme.desc: An old girlfriend of Ruditsky's, Millie Grayson, offers to help get evidence on her old boyfriend Jurgie Jorgenson.

programme.title: Gang Busters
programme.desc: A man uses poison gas to rob Chicago's currency exchanges.

programme.title: Dick Tracy
programme.desc: Dick Tracy and Steve Lockwood are hot on the trail of Pa Stark, who has stolen a new Navy torpedo boat.

programme.title: Angel on My Shoulder
programme.desc: A murdered gangster makes a deal with the devil, agreeing to take over and corrupt a crusading judge's identity in return for avenging his murder.

programme.title: Gang Busters
programme.desc: Police detective Bill Bannister is assigned to run down an unknown gang of terrorists who has spread a net of crime over the city in this 1942 serial based on the popular radio series.

programme.title: Dick Tracy
programme.desc: Ralph Byrd plays the detective in episodes from the 1950s TV series.

programme.title: White Zombie
programme.desc: A plantation owner takes the help of a voodoo master to lure an innocent woman, even though she loves someone else.

programme.title: Bela Lugosi Meets a Brooklyn Gorilla
programme.desc: Brooklyn buddies (Duke Mitchell, Sammy Petrillo) are stranded on an island with a mad doctor (Bela Lugosi) who turns one of them into a gorilla.

programme.title: The Ape Man
programme.desc: A doctor (Bela Lugosi) injects himself with ape fluid and turns hairy; he needs human fluid to turn back.
